sentences.english: Hot summer days are coming while the high-grade summer goods will raise another heat wave.
sentences.chinese: 伏天将临，夏日精晶将掀起又一个热季狂潮。

sentences.english: Congestion and traffic pollution are growing problems on China’s roads as car ownership surges.
sentences.chinese: 因车辆购买狂潮导致道路拥挤和塞车问题日益严峻。

sentences.english: Anelka is due a flurry of goals.
sentences.chinese: 阿内尔卡会上演进球狂潮的。

sentences.english: Nicotiana tabacum, as botanists call it, was the first global commodity craze.
sentences.chinese: 植物学家所称作的烟草，是世界上第一股商品狂潮。

sentences.english: The Galaxy, meanwhile, is still coming to grips with its own flood of applicants.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，银河队正在控制他们自己的申请狂潮。

sentences.english: The building boom began after the country had won in the Eurovision Song Contest.
sentences.chinese: 建筑狂潮在阿塞拜疆获得在欧洲歌唱大赛胜利后开始。
并购狂潮紧追绿色趋势。

sentences.english: The past two years have seen a frenzy of institution-building.
sentences.chinese: 过去的两年见证了一场基础设施建设的狂潮。

sentences.english: Mid-Autumn purchase small peak has gone, then follow the tide of 11.
sentences.chinese: 中秋购机小高峰已经远去，紧接着十一狂潮接踵而来。

sentences.english: For several years Baku has been experiencing an incredible building boom.
sentences.chinese: 几年以来，巴库一直体验着不可思议的建筑狂潮。

sentences.english: A moral panic about devil-worship only drove sales higher.
sentences.chinese: 恶魔崇拜的思想狂潮只不过让其销量锦上添花而已。

definition: to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
hurricane/violent reform or revolution/violent movement or force
lit. foul wind and bloody rain (idiom)/fig. reign of terror/carnage
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
high tide/high water/upsurge/climax/orgasm/chorus (part of a song)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
